cofh.api.energy

Interface IEnergyTransport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEnergyConnection, IEnergyHandler, IEnergyProvider, IEnergyReceiver

    public interface IEnergyTransport
extends IEnergyProvider, IEnergyReceiver
    Implement this interface on Tile Entities which transport energy. This is used to "negotiate" connection types between two separate IEnergyTransports, allowing users to set flow direction and allowing for networks Of IEnergyTransports to intelligently transfer energy to other networks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType
      The type of interface for a given side of a IEnergyTransport.

      • getTransportState

        IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType getTransportState(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing from)
        Indicates to other IEnergyTransports the state of the given side. See IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType for details. For clarity of state tracking, on a tile update from another IEnergyTransport, if its mode has changed from the opposite of your own mode on that side, you should change your mode to the opposite of its mode. When the user alters your mode and your state is:
        BALANCE, your mode should change to IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType.RECEIVE.
        RECEIVE, your mode should change to IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType.SEND.
        SEND, your mode should change to IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType.BALANCE.
        This is not required, but will be easier for users.
        Parameters:
        from - The side
        Returns:
        The type of connection to establish on this side. null is NOT a valid value

      • setTransportState

        boolean setTransportState(IEnergyTransport.InterfaceType state,
                          net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing from)
        This method is provided primarily for the purposes of automation tools, and should not need to be called by another IEnergyTransport. Calls to this method may fail if this IEnergyTransport has been secured by a user.
        Parameters:
        state - The new state
        from - The side
        Returns:
        Whether or not state was successfully altered.
